lines.text: Are you goin' to let me have a good time in my own quiet way, or must I take this place apart?
Until I got married, I was decent.

[Opening lines. Intertitle]
The Waterfront of New York - The end of many journeys, the beginning of many adventures.

[Regarding Andy]
He's the most even-tempered guy I ever knew - always sore!
Are you goin' to let me have a good time in my own quiet way - or am I gonna take this place apart?

[Leering at Mae's figure in her tight-fitting dress]
I've sailed the Seven seas, but I've never seen a craft as trim as you!
I've always been like this. There ain't no power on earth that could ever keep me ashore!
Come on out o' this - before you get into another mess!
I could of told you before that she was no good - like all females!
I s'pose you've forgot about gettin' married, too.
Chief, last night's over. Today's another day!
I've had to many good times.
